reviews.sentence: Long Island Gem. My family stayed. the Melville Mariot for a Winter Blues fix and it surely did the trick. A welcoming front desk especially Harmony start you off in a positive and welcoming way. Susan. Food Services goes above and beyond and makes you feel like family. and always the can do attitude. Mohammed. the pool was terrific with the kids and in keeping the pool clean and warm as you looked out the big windows to huge snow drifts. The hotel food was very good nice atmosphere with Adriana and Maria wonderful with the kids and so sincere professional in their work. It was sad to leave but we were refreshed by a great get a way.

4 Weeks straight. I have to admit if you have to travel for work being stuck here is awesome. Indoor pool bar concierge great customer service glass elevators and great food. The care from the front desk to the concierge attendants to room service is top notch.

Mohamed made the day. Very nicely updated hotel for our lacrosse tournament this weekend. The kids had a blast and the parents were comfortable and relaxed. Pool side was great and we thank Mohamed for this. He was the best and made our stay memorable. This guy worked his tail off from morning till night and was there to help out whenever needed. And always with a big smile. Thanks Mohamed. I hope they take good care of you because you are what makes me want to come back to this Mariot when I have so many choices.

For the money I expected more. Pool were very nice the bed was very comfortable but the layout of the hotel was awkward. Beautiful lobby with glass elevators on one side but the other wing I had hotel was more like a cheaper hotel. We had to use the crappy service elevator to the pool that needs some sprucing up. If your room is near lobby and restrain great if not it is not convient.
Well its a huge hotel very nice people work there. The door you walk in is motion sencerdits so cool. Nice pool and nice rooms. Beautiful.
Spacious good fitness facility and pool.

Wedding weekend. The hotel is solid. It was recently renovated but still retains a late 80s 90s decor. The indoor pool is a lovely touch and there is a decent gym. The hotel bar is also good and stays open late on the weekends. Other than that there is not much to say. The rooms are clean but ask for one that faces the atrium. We stayed in a room far at the end facing the conference rooms. Not much of a view but we were just there for one night. it is close to wedding venues and the highway but there is not much around there otherwise.

Great indoor pool and restaurant bar. Stayed here for my sons birthday had a great time. The staff was very nice especially Mohammed at the pol he was so helpful and accommodating to us. Rooms need updating but apparently the whole place is being redone in 2018. The lobby and restaurant are all new and beautiful. Near everything in the area.

A Diamond in the Rough. Gem of a hotel. Beautiful open atrium with gardens and glass ceilings that allow light to stream into the huge lobby. Small pool is tucked away from the main lobby but on the atrium level. PROS. Great restaurant that has different areas for lounging dining drinking light snacks appetizers breakfast buffet. Complaining vegetarians. Stay home jez. All reasonably priced. Food is fresh and their menu has lots of variety. Clean rooms comfortable bed sitting chair. yes sliding glass door on inside rooms looking out onto atrium room darkening shades free WiFi. Friendly VERY helpful staff at the front desk and each employee you pass in the hotel acknowledges you every day all day. Train station right down the road that you can take into the city. Front desk provides a schedule. Hotel was in a nice setting and since it was fall drives around the area and into town were lovely. CONS. Older building so some hallway and elevator areas naturally have a bit of wear but that is to be expected rooms were not worn at alThe path to the main elevator to the rooms is a bit of a trek across the lobby up a small carpeted stairway and then a bit of a winding way down the hall but the signs to the rooms and elevators once in the hallways are clear. We could not get the heat to go on our first day there but it was addressed immediately and resolved. Rooms are not solidly insulated some you hear some noise from hallway but not bad. We will definitely stay again and may even stay here from now on and train into the city when we come to visit NYC.

Pool. The person responsible for the pool maintenance was amazing. I wish I knew his name. He made sure we were comfortable and that my 4 year old had a vest so he could swim around the pool safely. He also kept checking in with us and the other guests hanging by the pool. The indoor pool There is a strip mall about 5 mins. from the hotel. I did not go shopping because I was in the area for a baby shower but drove by it. None that I could think of.

Mariot Stay. So my cousin got married and my wife and I stayed over at the Melville Mariot. While there for two nights we used the pool exercise room and bar restaurant. All nice enough. The bed a little too soft for my wifes taste was quickly remedied. They brought boards up to slip under the mattress. This was a good fix. The room was clean as was the hotel common areas. The room could have used a fresh coat of paint and the shades had a tear but nothing that would stop us from going back. The food at the bar I ate most salads was nothing fancy or lavished but we ate three meals there so I have to say good. The staff were pleasant and eager to please and that is the most important thing. I would recommend this hotel.
Wish we would have known about the construction other then that it was fine. Pool needs to be heated though.

Interesting layout noisy indoor pool area. Large open interior space with lots of light even on a gloomy day. We arrived early and hotel staff was able to have our room available earlier than check in allowing us to have time to prepare for the gathering we had traveled to attend. Our room was an interior first floor two queen bed room and a large sliding door that faced the pool. That made for a noisy evening in our room after arriving back as there were multiple children enjoying the pool. Saving grace was the hotel had a zero tolerance noise policy after 10 pm and the rest of the night was very quiet. Beds very comfortable and room and well appointed. Large open lobby bright and welcoming. Lots of greenery making it feel like a nice indoor garden. Did not have time to explore area there for a family event only. Rooms near the pool are subjected to much noise during the day and evening not sure what sound proofing could be done.

Vary nice. Before this stay I had not been to this hotel in over 5 years. The lobby as well as the rooms have been refurbished since then and it looks great. Helpful staff comfortable beds and Concierge Lounge if you qualify. This hotel caters mostly to business travelers but does have an indoor pool and free self parking.

GIANT ECHO CHAMBER. The property is very big and there have been a lot of renovations. BUT there were some areas where they obviously cut corners. From simple things like exposed plumbing not hidden by the bathroom counter to the big deal the less than noise canceling sliding glass wall. I am lying in bed listening to yelling kids playing in the pool. If you get stuck in one of the greenhouse pool side rooms do not expect any peace in your room during pool hours. Also if you are a platinum member do not expect access to an M lounge or Concierge lounge on a Friday or all weekend for that matter. I watched the front desk offer 750 points to my boss for that inconvenience. 750 is laughable to a platinum member. do not forget to bring your wallet for the buffet breakfast it is not very tasty but it will cost you like it was.

Room was new. Staff very friendly and helpful. Nice lobby and bar area. Nobody at the pool next time I will bring my bathing suit.

We booked this hotel because we were in town for a surprise party it had an indoor pool. We figure we can hang by pool before the party. When we arrived there was a conference a rather loud one going on in the Atrium Lobby area. WE were checked in nicely asked where the pool was they directed us to the end of the Atrium which was rather chilly for an indoor Atrium it was well below 70 Degrees. We went through the conference to the pool which was strangely in the same 70 Degree Atrium as the ongoing conference Went into the pool area besides the air being cold the water temperature was cold not warm but cold between the water temperature the air temperature hanging by the pool was not an option. Not to mention if we did the loud conference echoed throughout the Atrium even throughout the hotel. Yes the hotel is loud from our room we heard every one exiting entering there rooms blow dryers showers running talking in the hallway whomever was arriving leaving the hotel outside. We thought there was an open window there was not. Now the most disturbing thing was the construction in our hallway where they completely taped up the smoke detector to prevent any construction dust to set them off I am thinking. They remained taped through the night we discovered the next morning thankfully they were not needed but if there was a problem we would not know in a timely fashion. Sorry but explore other options in the area before booking this property.
The pool was open just a bit too late and where it is positioned in the hotel although convenient to rooms it made for a loud evening.

I recommended to my friends. the pool guy he was very kind and the staff of the restaurant and 2 of the lady ’s in the front desk The lady who prepare the food right there she was excellent. The pool was ok but ambient when we get out the water was a little cold.
